--------------------
Text: Saint Thorlak Thorhallsson (Old Norse: "Þorlákr Þórhallsson" ; Icelandic: "Þorlákur Þórhallsson" ; Latin: "Thorlacus" ; 1133 – December 23, 1193), also spelled Thorlac, is the patron saint of Iceland.
Triplets:<Saint Thorlak Thorhallsson
2:
--------------------
Text: Saint Thorlak:  Thorlac’s relics were translated to the cathedral of Skálholt in 1198, not long after his successor as bishop, Páll Jónsson, announced at the Althing that vows could be made to Thorlac.
Triplets:<Saint Thorlak
